head.title: The Long and the Short of Campaigning

hedline.hl1: The Long and the Short of Campaigning

block.p: Jeff Greenfield's pointed humor (Op-Ed, June 6) mistakes brevity for informality. In this folksy political climate, some candidates enlist the former to convey the latter, hoping to reassure the public that they're just like us.

Jeff Greenfield's pointed humor (Op-Ed, June 6) mistakes brevity for informality. In this folksy political climate, some candidates enlist the former to convey the latter, hoping to reassure the public that they're just like us.

The public, though, having recently lived through a most informal approach to adult and presidential responsibility, appears to have made candor, self-acceptance and self-confidence -- three elements of real maturity -- a key part of its election criteria.
The writer is a professor of political science at CUNY and a psychoanalyst.
